text: The Kapfenberger SV is a football club from Kapfenberg, Styria. ==History== The club was founded in 1919. Before the Second World War he played under the name Kapfenberger SC and was an important part of Styrian football. 1947 the club was new founded and got new sections (table tennis, ski and handball). During the 1950´s and 60´s Kapfenberg played in the Staatsliga A and in the 1980´s in the 2.Division. In 1997 the club, which was only a section of the SV, was dissolved from the Kapfenberger SV and became a legaly independent club. From 2002/03 to 2007/08 the club played in the Erste Liga and became Champion in the 2007/08 season. In the season 2008/09 the club played in the Bundesliga for the first time since 41 years. In the 2009/10 season the LASK was beaten 7:2, which was the highest victory in the club history. The club plays in the Franz-Fekete-Stadium, which was built in 1951 and named after a former mayor of Kapfenberg. ==Notable players== *Karl Steinmetz played for the Austrian team in the 1936 Olympic games in Berlin and reached the silver medal. He scored 3 goals in this tournament. ==Current squad== === Coaches === * Abdulah Ibraković - coach * David Sencar- assistance coach * Helmut Walchhütter- goalkeeper coach ==Gallery== File:Werner Gregoritsch - Kapfenberger SV (Bild 2a).jpg|Werner Gregoritsch coach of KSV File:Kapfenberger SV – Präsident Erwin Fuchs2 (Portrait) (bearb.).JPG|Erwin Fuchs chairman File:Deni Alar - SV Kapfenberg (quer).jpg| Deni Alar File:REDS – Fanklub der Kapfenberger SV bei einem Freundschaftstestspiel.JPG|Fans of KSV File:SV kapfenberg (1 -0 gegen FC Red Bull Salzburg).JPG|Players celebrating a goal versus Red Bull Salzburg ==Other websites== *SV Kapfenberg Official homepage (German) Category:Austrian football clubs Category:Football clubs of Styria Category:1919 establishments in Austria
title: SV Kapfenberg
